[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Trait: Hash for EncryptPubKey] [Determinism] Does hashing use a deterministic serialization (to_bytes()), or can non-deterministic encoding cause the same key to hash differently across validators, breaking consensus? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Function: EncryptPubKey::to_bytes()] [Compression safety] Does to_compressed() always succeed for valid group elements, or can certain edge-case points cause compression failures that attackers can exploit to DoS the DKG protocol? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Trait: From<&EncryptPubKey> for $GTProjective] [Type confusion] Can attackers exploit the conversion to access raw group elements and perform invalid operations that bypass security checks in higher-level PVSS code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Trait: Debug for EncryptPubKey] [Information leakage] Does hex encoding in Debug implementation expose sensitive information that could help attackers correlate keys across different protocol phases? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Concept: ek = h^{dk^{-1}}] [Inverse computation] Is the relationship between DecryptPrivKey and EncryptPubKey properly enforced during key derivation, or can attackers register mismatched key pairs that break decryption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Concept: ek = h^{dk^{-1}}] [Division by zero] Can an attacker set dk = 0 in DecryptPrivKey, causing infinite loop or panic when computing dk^{-1} during encryption key derivation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [g1 vs g2 modules] [Cross-group attack] Can attackers mix g1 and g2 keys in the PVSS protocol, using a G1-based encryption key with G2-based public parameters to cause type confusion and protocol failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Modules g1/g2] [Pairing compatibility] If g1 encryption keys are paired with g2 public parameters in bilinear map operations, can attackers exploit mismatched groups to forge proofs or bypass verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Trait: ValidCryptoMaterial] [Empty AIP_80_PREFIX] Does the empty AIP-80 prefix allow attackers to create malicious serialized keys that bypass protocol-level validation expecting specific prefixes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Trait: ValidCryptoMaterial for DecryptPrivKey] [Serialization consistency] Can attackers exploit differences between to_bytes() (little-endian) and the expected serialization format to inject keys that serialize differently than they deserialize? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Trait: TryFrom for DecryptPrivKey] [Error handling] Does try_from() return proper errors for all invalid inputs, or can certain malformed byte arrays cause panics that attackers can use to crash validator nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Trait: TryFrom for EncryptPubKey] [Length attack] Can attackers provide byte arrays longer than ENCRYPT_KEY_NUM_BYTES that pass initial validation but cause buffer overflows during deserialization? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Function: scalar_from_bytes_le()] [Modular reduction] Does scalar deserialization properly reduce large values modulo the field order, or can attackers inject out-of-range scalars that cause arithmetic errors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Function: $gt_proj_from_bytes()] [Decompression bomb] Can attackers provide compressed points that decompress to consume excessive memory or CPU, causing DoS during validator key registration? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Dependency: blstrs] [Curve twist attack] Can attackers inject points on the curve twist instead of the main curve, bypassing $gt_proj_from_bytes() validation and breaking the DLOG hardness assumption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Dependency: blstrs] [Invalid curve attack] Can attackers provide points that lie on a different curve with weaker security parameters, allowing them to solve DLOG faster and recover decryption keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Constant: SCALAR_NUM_BYTES] [Field order mismatch] If SCALAR_NUM_BYTES doesn't match the actual field order size, can attackers inject scalars that are valid byte sequences but invalid field elements? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Constant: G1_PROJ_NUM_BYTES/G2_PROJ_NUM_BYTES] [Size assumptions] Can attackers exploit hardcoded size constants that differ from actual group element sizes to cause truncation or buffer overflow? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Function: random_scalar()] [PRNG state] Can attackers manipulate validator PRNG state through network messages or side channels to predict future DecryptPrivKey values generated by Uniform::generate()? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Function: to_compressed()] [Point compression] Does point compression use constant-time algorithms, or can timing side-channels during compression reveal bits of the scalar used to derive the public key? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Usage in DKG] [Key reuse] Can malicious validators reuse the same DecryptPrivKey across multiple DKG epochs, allowing them to link transcripts and potentially collaborate to reconstruct dealt secrets? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Usage in DKG] [Rogue key attack] Can attackers register encryption keys ek computed as products of other validators' keys, allowing them to decrypt shares intended for multiple validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Usage in PVSS] [Malleability] Can attackers modify encrypted shares in transit by exploiting malleability in the encryption scheme, causing validators to decrypt different values than intended? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Usage in PVSS] [Share recovery] If encryption is deterministic, can attackers who observe multiple DKG runs recover decryption keys by analyzing patterns in encrypted shares across epochs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Integration with consensus] [Epoch transition] During validator set changes, can attackers exploit timing windows where old and new encryption keys coexist to decrypt shares with wrong keys? (High)
